Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Impact of Preoperative Vascular Mapping on Long-term RC-AVF Failure

Participants.evidence: Conducted at the Vascular Surgery Department, Emergency County Hospital of Târgu Mureș, this retrospective, monocentric, observational study enrolled 110 patients with end-stage kidney disease (ESKD) from 2018 to 2024.

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the role of preoperative vascular mapping in long-term radio-cephalic arteriovenous fistula (RC-AVF) failure, focusing on adherence to European Society of Vascular Surgery (ESVS) guidelines.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was long-term RC-AVF failure, monitored over a mean follow-up of 1.98 years.

Number_Randomised.evidence: this retrospective, monocentric, observational study enrolled 110 patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: Adherence to guidelines correlated with reduced long-term failure (HR: 0.44, p = 0.012), but this lost significance after adjusting for cardiovascular risk factors and CVC presence (HR: 0.69, p = 0.328). Only cephalic vein diameter remained an independent predictor (HR: 0.68, p = 0.026).
